conclusion: Identify the problem involves a parallel-plate capacitor with capacitance C, charge Q, and plate separation d, with a point charge q at the midpoint.
Recall basic concepts about capacitors and electric fields, including the establishment of an electric field between charged plates.
The electric field (E) in a parallel-plate capacitor is uniform and calculated using E = Q / (ε₀ A).
Capacitance (C) of a parallel-plate capacitor is given by C = ε₀ (A/d).
Express Q in terms of C and V using Q = C V.
Electric field E is related to potential difference V and distance d by E = V/d.
Find force on charge q using F = q E = q (V/d).
Express V in terms of Q and C using V = Q/C.
Substitute V into force equation to get F = q (Q/Cd).
